snippet: As lawmakers in Washington appear far apart in negotiations that would prevent the automatic tax increases and spending cuts scheduled for Jan. 1, many still doubt that an agreement will be reached.
abstract: As lawmakers in Washington appear far apart in negotiations that would prevent the automatic tax increases and spending cuts scheduled for Jan. 1, many still doubt that an agreement will be reached.
lead_paragraph: Public opinion about the pending fiscal crisis has not changed in the past three weeks, according to the latest national survey conducted by the Pew Research Center and The Washington Post.

headline.main: Polls Show Public Skeptical of a Deal on the Deficit
